4.  **Alex Turk**  
    Fan writer
    
    ![Image 31: Manchester United fan's voice banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/d13f/live/f1ac4610-3b6c-11ee-bde6-7ffba94c56ae.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 32: Ruben Amorim crouches on the touchline during Manchester United's game at Ipswich](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/012c/live/6ad04300-ab58-11ef-9323-7924a1e1d563.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Why did Manchester United not look as good as Sporting against [Ipswich Town](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) on Sunday? Can this Ruben Amorim fella walk the walk as well as he talks the talk? How is this 3-4-3 system going to click?
    
    Those would be questions of an individual needing to understand the reality of the situation Amorim has inherited from Erik ten Hag.
    
    Such a drastic change of vision would have been challenging to instil with a full pre-season at his disposal. United visited Portman Road with two training sessions in the tank.
    
    Amorim understands that only wins will buy him time, but that has not deterred his repeated cries for patience.
    
    As long as he persists with his three-at-the-back philosophy and his guarantee of a clear identity - something United have missed for far too long - supporters will offer the patience he desires.
    
    Not much sense is required to understand why the Red Devils did not enjoy a winning start to life under Amorim at Ipswich.
    
    It was simple. The 3-4-3 formation was present, unlike the profile of player that made his tactics so effective in Portugal.
    
    Amorim's high-octane demands are not built for a 36-year-old operating as a left-sided centre-back and two midfielders aged 32 powering the engine room.
    
    United lacked legs in defence and midfield - already a known issue - and efficient decision-making in attack - also no surprise.
    
    Amorim cannot be judged this early on.
    
    I loved his post-match quote about staying true to his plan, regardless of the squad at his disposal, rather than adapting his methods in search of short-term results.
    
    Ten Hag opted for the latter, ultimately prompting the arrival of the sixth permanent boss since Sir Alex Ferguson after a predictable plight.
    
    This time around, the focus should be on short-term pain for long-term gain.
    
    _Find more from Alex Turk at_ [_Stretford Paddock_, external](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7w8GnTF2Sp3wldDMtCCtVw)
    
    ![Image 33: An image detailing how to follow your Premier League team on BBC Sport: "On the app? Tap the bell icon to get news about your club sent to you. Signed in on a browser? Hit 'Follow' to stay up to date.](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/266a/live/483e2580-b62d-11ee-bc2f-cb5579b90709.jpg.webp)
    
5.  ![Image 34: Andre Onana](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/2556/live/21f03ae0-abef-11ef-a678-8d26f6b8be8a.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Image caption,
    
    Andre Onana joined Manchester United from Inter Milan for £47m in July 2023
    
    Manchester United goalkeeper Andre Onana has been given the Player Impact Award by international players' union Fifpro for his charity work.
    
    Onana set up the Andre Onana Foundation to provide free medical care and surgeries for underprivileged children and adults in Cameroon and other countries in sub-Saharan Africa.
    
    Doctors have performed more than 1,200 operations in the past three years.
    
    Onana, 28, said he felt "a responsibility to give back and help others".
    
    "When I passed through Barcelona, Amsterdam and Milan on my way to Manchester United, I had people who helped me on that journey," he said.
    
    "When I was down, they gave me a hand so that I could stand up. I’ve never forgotten the help I received."
    
6.  BBC Radio 5 Live's Monday Night Club debated Manchester United's draw with [Ipswich](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) in Ruben Amorim's first game in charge.
    
    Former Premier League midfielder Michael Brown described the performance as a "reality check" and Chris Sutton said Amorim will have realised the squad is "bang average" and that "there is a hell of a lot of work to do".

7.  When Marcus Rashford scored within the first two minutes of Ruben Amorim's Manchester United era beginning, it had many fans wondering just what might be possible.
    
    But they were brought back down to earth by [Ipswich](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) winger Omari Hutchinson's strike before half-time.
    
    And in the latest episode of BBC Radio Manchester's The Devils' Advocate podcast, the team have been deciding what to make of the new boss' first game in charge.

8.  ![Image 37: Gossip graphic](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/c043/live/ecb3f520-0913-11ef-82e8-cd354766a224.png.webp)

9.  ![Image 38: The Devils' Advocate podcast graphic](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/01d2/live/6e70c820-3aa3-11ef-a044-9d4367d5b599.jpg.webp)
    
    Ruben Amorim's first game in charge of Manchester United ended in a 1-1 draw against Ipswich Town and the latest episode of BBC Radio Manchester's The Devils' Advocate has landed to unpick it all.
    
    In this week's show, Gaz Drinkwater and Joe McGrath look at who stood out at Portman Road and discuss how United's players took to the new system.
    
    [Listen to the full episode on BBC Sounds](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0k6swr7)
    
    ![Image 39: Listen on BBC Sounds banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/2e39/live/e93a4330-3aa1-11ef-bbe0-29f79e992ddd.jpg.webp)
    
10.  ![Image 40: Chief football writer Phil McNulty byline banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/55a5/live/13026c10-3aa7-11ef-bbe0-29f79e992ddd.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 41: Manchester United's Portuguese head coach Ruben Amorim (L) shakes hands with Manchester United's Cameroonian goalkeeper #24 Andre Onana (R) at the end of the English Premier League football match between Ipswich Town and Manchester United at Portman Road](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/e00e/live/579abfe0-ab44-11ef-8ab9-9192db313061.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    **BBC Sport's chief football writer Phil McNulty has been answering your questions.**
    
    **Mike asked:** Manchester United may 'only' be six points off fourth place, but there are a lot of teams in between. Clearly not all teams above are going to drop more points than United do. I feel we should stop focusing on fourth place and focus on improvement for next season. Where we finish is where we finish.
    
    I don't know if it is instant gratification or a lack of knowledge among many fans, but (tell me if I am wrong) a new coach does not simply say: 'Now we set up like this, you play this position and problem solved'. It takes a lot of time and practice to replace old ways and habits with new ones.
    
    I say we need to be patient and judge it in the new season. What is your take on whether Manchester United are likely to improve?
    
    **Phil answered:** These are all very good points and Ruben Amorim made a lot of them himself after the draw at Ipswich Town, when he pointed out that Manchester United will have to "suffer" while he implements his tactical tweaks, saying it was worth risking things tactically now to feel the benefit next season.
    
    So yes, patience will be needed and, in my experience, Manchester United fans are remarkably patient with their managers.
    
    What we have seen from Amorim already is a clear identity in terms of how he wants to play and a clear idea of his strategy. I don't think we ever really saw that from Erik ten Hag.
    
    I think United will improve – and I wouldn't write off fourth place either, because I really believe that slot is wide open – but it will take time and patience, and there will be bumps along the way.
    
11.  [### 14:26 25 NovemberSheeran sorry for interrupting Amorim interview, published at 14:26 25 NovemberSheeran sorry for interrupting Amorim interview](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/articles/cyv7zgj0l52o)
    
    *   Attribution
        
        [Premier League](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/premier-league)
        
    
    ![Image 42: Ed Sheeran at Ipswich Town ](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/480/cpsprodpb/551d/live/b20d9400-ab37-11ef-8d14-b38ce06af7f3.jpg)
    
12.  ![Image 44: Ruben Amorim crouches on touchline during match](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/91ba/live/8b2c9540-ab21-11ef-8487-d5a0de19ffaf.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Manchester United's new formation may have to "evolve into something else" if they are going to being competitive in the Premier League, says former [Liverpool](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool) midfielder Danny Murphy.
    
    New boss Ruben Amorim used his favoured formation of three at the back in his first game in charge against [Ipswich](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) on Sunday.
    
    It was an unfamiliar set-up for the backline and, despite United taking an early lead within two minutes, they ultimately drew 1-1 against the newly promoted side.
    
    "I would be amazed if they are still playing a 3-4-3 in a year's time," Murphy said on Match of the Day 2.
    
    "This league is very, very different than continental leagues. We have only had [Chelsea](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea) in recent years win playing that system. And, let's be honest, they had Kante and Matic - two wonderful midfielders in the middle of the pitch, plus Costa up top with Hazard supporting him and helping them as well.
    
    "They \[Manchester United\] don't have those players yet and how do you find them? It costs hundreds of millions to get the best players in the world.
    
    "When you play three at the back against the majority of good teams in our league who play three high, you end up being a five and that is really difficult.
    
    "If Manchester United are going to become much better and be competitive, I think that 3-4-3 will evolve into something else."
    
    [Watch the full discussion on BBC iPlayer](https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/m0025f6r/match-of-the-day-2-202425-24112024)
    
13.  ![Image 45: Your views banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/2f7f/live/95709000-0915-11ef-bee9-6125e244a4cd.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 46: Luke Shaw of Manchester United battles for possession with Omari Hutchinson of Ipswich Town](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/39c4/live/f4a5c660-aaa7-11ef-821d-af5442865c2a.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    We asked for your thoughts after Sunday's Premier League game between Ipswich Town and Manchester United, which ended in a 1-1 draw.
    
    Here are some of your comments:
    
    **Ipswich towns**
    
    **Matt**: I thought we looked like a proper Premier League team. We were better than Manchester United. This line-up is definitely our strongest 11 (apart from the absent Greaves). If we continue to play like this we will stay up. Omari was outstanding.
    
    **James**: This was another step in the right direction for Town, with a fully deserved point. It was frustrating to concede so early, as we were the team in the ascendancy in the first half, which was capped by a superb goal by Omari Hutchinson. There wasn't much between the two sides in the second half and we again showed our resilience to see out the draw.
    
    **Michael**: Wonderful performance by Town after what some would say is our regular early mistake. We battled well and had we won the game it would not have been an injustice. Credit should also go to the referee, Anthony Taylor, who allowed the game to flow and kept control throughout.
    
    **Phillip**: We more than matched a top team in the Premier League/ Europe. We probably should have got all three points. We have to believe in this fantastic team of ours because we were brilliant, as we were at T[ottenham](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/tottenham-hotspur). We are building something special. Kieran McKenna, what can I say, amazing achievement. Absolutely buzzing.
    
    **United fans**
    
    **Mike58**: Obviously disappointed not to win but a draw was the least Ipswich deserved. Signs of life to come - a manager/coach with tactical knowledge and an identity. He will improve these players, for sure. Having had only days to work with these players he has overachieved. Onana clear player of the match for United.
    
    **Mark**: Early days but the same old problems resurfaced and we need to stop giving the ball away cheaply. We bossed the second half and deserved the win, but the cutting edge is still missing up front and we should be more clinical. Hopefully Amorin will iron these problems out and we will improve - slowly but steadily.
    
    **Toni**: Wasn't expecting miracles, to be honest. Amorim has a lot of work to do. However, some players can be moved on in January. We cannot and must not have a squad of uninterested professionals. A draw was good enough but we need more effort.
    
    **Davos**: A steady start for Amorim. He has plenty of work to do to get the boys firing on all cylinders. The midfield seemed a little slow at times and we just need a striker to be in the box for when the ball is played into that area as both Zirkzee and Hojlund look lost. Onwards and upwards.

Hit 'Follow' to stay up to date.](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/51a6/live/913754d0-476b-11ef-96a8-e710c6bfc866.jpg.webp)
    
14.  **Simon Stone**  
    Chief football news reporter
    
    ![Image 48: Monday's news paper back pages](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/0916/live/73b44a40-ab0b-11ef-bdf5-b7cb2fa86e10.jpg.webp)Image source, Mirror and Star
    
    Image caption,
    
    Monday's papers focus on Amorim's view his players will "suffer" in order to progress
    
    Ruben Amorim asked Manchester United's hierarchy if he could join the club in the summer rather than in mid-season.
    
    United said no.
    
    It is different owners calling the shots at Old Trafford now but their memories wouldn't have to be long to recall the issues created by Ralf Rangnick's ill-fated stint as interim.
    
    Their reasoning for wanting Amorim now are sound.
    
    Similarly, Amorim is one of the most highly rated young coaches in Europe. United chief executive Omar Berrada is a big fan. Going after him also made sense.
    
    The problem is having made the calls, United are now in a position where the new coach is trying to implement a new playing style, knowing there are too many midweek matches looming to allow proper training on shape and positioning, which may lead to unexpected defeats.
    
    As a club, they cannot afford to just toss away seasons as part of a big rebuild. That is not the idea behind bringing someone in like Amorim.
    
    But, at best, it is a calculated gamble.
    
    United dropped two points at Portman Road. They remain in the bottom half of the table. That situation needs to change.
    
    ![Image 49: Monday's newspaper back pages](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/8ea9/live/578e53b0-ab0b-11ef-a4fe-a3e9a6c5d640.jpg.webp)Image source, Daily Express and Guardian
    
15.  ![Image 50: Ruben Amorim ](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/1b47/live/36ed8ac0-ab08-11ef-b429-5b139d1e7a7e.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Former Premier League striker Glenn Murray is confident that Manchester United's performances under Ruben Amorim "will only get better" but believes the new boss will be working on the fitness of his players.
    
    Amorim kicked-off his tenure on Sunday with a draw at [Ipswich Town](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town), leaving United 12th in the Premier League.
    
    "Anyone at Manchester United should be good enough to fall into a different system under any manager," said Murray on the BBC Radio 5 Live Football Daily podcast. "I am glad that he lined the team-up in the way he wanted as 3-4-3 is his identity and I am sure it will only get better.
    
    "One thing I noticed is that he is not happy with their physicality. He wants them to be fitter."
    
    Despite their fast start, with Marcus Rashford scoring after just 81 seconds, United soon settled into a familiar pattern and found themselves exposed far too easily when Ipswich countered.
    
    "Amorim will be looking at this group of players and already thinking that some of them will not be here in a few months time," added former Premier League midfielder Don Hutchison. "He knows he will need to move a lot of these players on.
    
    "But you can understand and see what he wants to do in the future."

Manchester United may have to play £86m waiting game as Ruben Amorim eyes striker transfer
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United news and opinion as we take a look at some of the stories doing the rounds at Old Trafford over the last 24 hours.

Manchester United head coach [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) will have his first taste of European football at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) this week, after what may be seen as a disappointing start in the Premier League.

The Red Devils [drew 1-1 with newly-promoted Ipswich Town](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-andre-30440825) in the new boss’ first game in charge on Sunday afternoon. They will look to go one better when Bodo/Glimt visit Old Trafford in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) on Thursday night (8pm kick-off).

As well as preparing for upcoming games, Amorim is also likely to be looking ahead to the January transfer window. After having some time to assess his squad, the new head coach may have a chance to bring in a couple of his players when the window opens at the start of next year.

**READ MORE: [Man United's strongest line-up after Evan Ferguson signing as Ruben Amorim handed dream move](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-uniteds-strongest-line-up-30458500)**

**READ MORE: [Manchester United dealt Euro blow as they face UEFA Youth League challenge](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-dealt-euro-blow-30458176)**

So, it’s no surprise that United continue to be linked with players. With that in mind, MEN Sport have taken a look at a couple of the stories doing the rounds, and given our own thoughts on the situation.

#### United ‘eye’ £83m man

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are reportedly interested in a move for Napoli winger Khvicha Kvaratskhelia ahead of the January transfer window. Sportmediaset, via [Get Italian Football News](https://www.getfootballnewsitaly.com/2024/manchester-united-serious-in-move-for-napolis-khvicha-kvaratskhelia/) report that United are 'serious' about the player, but would need to offer a fee of around €100 million (£83.48m) to temp Napoli into selling.

Napoli are said to be keen on getting the player tied down to a new contract, with his current one expiring in 2027. However, no agreement has yet been reached, and United are said to be willing to offer a bigger deal to the player.

**MENSport says**: _Ruben Amorim is likely to be keen to add his own players to his squad when the January transfer window opens. However, how big of a budget he will have is still to be seen._

_While Kvaratskhelia is highly-rated, the 23-year-old has scored five times and provided two assists in 13 Serie A appearances this season, it seems unlikely that United will pay the asking price in the January window. It may be a move to keep a closer eye on in the summer window._

#### Striker transfer truth

An update has been given on United’s reported interest in Paris Saint-Germain striker Randal Kolo Muani. Reports earlier this month claimed that United had held talks over a potential loan deal for the forward in the January transfer window.

However, Sky Sports Germany’s Florian Plettenberg claims that there has been no discussions over the player. Instead, the journalist names Eintracht Frankfurt’s Omar Marmoush as on a list of potential targets ahead of the January window.

**MENSport says**: _United’s search for a striker in January could depend on the future of Joshua Zirkzee. There has been reports over clubs being interested in a loan deal, but I can’t see that happening just six months into his Old Trafford Career._

_Getting a loan deal for Kolo Muani, only to send Zirkzee on loan doesn’t really make too much sense. But a possible permanent deal for Marmoush, who has been linked with several Premier League clubs, could be an interesting one to keep an eye on._

Manchester United may have to play £86m waiting game as Ruben Amorim eyes striker transfer
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United news and opinion as we take a look at some of the stories doing the rounds at Old Trafford over the last 24 hours.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By

[Amie Wilson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/amie-wilson/)

*   04:30, 27 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia celebrates after scoring his team's second goal during the Italian Serie A match AC Milan vs Napoli at San Siro Stadium in Milan.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30459384.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_AC-Milan-v-Napoli-Serie-A.jpg)

Khvicha Kvaratskhelia has been named as a potential January target for Manchester United and Ruben Amorim. (Image: Piero Cruciatti/Anadolu via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United head coach [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) will have his first taste of European football at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) this week, after what may be seen as a disappointing start in the Premier League.

The Red Devils [drew 1-1 with newly-promoted Ipswich Town](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-andre-30440825) in the new boss’ first game in charge on Sunday afternoon. They will look to go one better when Bodo/Glimt visit Old Trafford in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) on Thursday night (8pm kick-off).

As well as preparing for upcoming games, Amorim is also likely to be looking ahead to the January transfer window. After having some time to assess his squad, the new head coach may have a chance to bring in a couple of his players when the window opens at the start of next year.

**READ MORE: [Man United's strongest line-up after Evan Ferguson signing as Ruben Amorim handed dream move](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-uniteds-strongest-line-up-30458500)**

**READ MORE: [Manchester United dealt Euro blow as they face UEFA Youth League challenge](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-dealt-euro-blow-30458176)**

So, it’s no surprise that United continue to be linked with players. With that in mind, MEN Sport have taken a look at a couple of the stories doing the rounds, and given our own thoughts on the situation.

#### United ‘eye’ £83m man

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are reportedly interested in a move for Napoli winger Khvicha Kvaratskhelia ahead of the January transfer window. Sportmediaset, via [Get Italian Football News](https://www.getfootballnewsitaly.com/2024/manchester-united-serious-in-move-for-napolis-khvicha-kvaratskhelia/) report that United are 'serious' about the player, but would need to offer a fee of around €100 million (£83.48m) to temp Napoli into selling.

Napoli are said to be keen on getting the player tied down to a new contract, with his current one expiring in 2027. However, no agreement has yet been reached, and United are said to be willing to offer a bigger deal to the player.

**MENSport says**: _Ruben Amorim is likely to be keen to add his own players to his squad when the January transfer window opens. However, how big of a budget he will have is still to be seen._

_While Kvaratskhelia is highly-rated, the 23-year-old has scored five times and provided two assists in 13 Serie A appearances this season, it seems unlikely that United will pay the asking price in the January window. It may be a move to keep a closer eye on in the summer window._

#### Striker transfer truth

An update has been given on United’s reported interest in Paris Saint-Germain striker Randal Kolo Muani. Reports earlier this month claimed that United had held talks over a potential loan deal for the forward in the January transfer window.

However, Sky Sports Germany’s Florian Plettenberg claims that there has been no discussions over the player. Instead, the journalist names Eintracht Frankfurt’s Omar Marmoush as on a list of potential targets ahead of the January window.

**MENSport says**: _United’s search for a striker in January could depend on the future of Joshua Zirkzee. There has been reports over clubs being interested in a loan deal, but I can’t see that happening just six months into his Old Trafford Career._

_Getting a loan deal for Kolo Muani, only to send Zirkzee on loan doesn’t really make too much sense. But a possible permanent deal for Marmoush, who has been linked with several Premier League clubs, could be an interesting one to keep an eye on._

Manchester United may have to play £86m waiting game as Ruben Amorim eyes striker transfer
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United news and opinion as we take a look at some of the stories doing the rounds at Old Trafford over the last 24 hours.

Manchester United head coach [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) will have his first taste of European football at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) this week, after what may be seen as a disappointing start in the Premier League.

The Red Devils [drew 1-1 with newly-promoted Ipswich Town](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-andre-30440825) in the new boss’ first game in charge on Sunday afternoon. They will look to go one better when Bodo/Glimt visit Old Trafford in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) on Thursday night (8pm kick-off).

As well as preparing for upcoming games, Amorim is also likely to be looking ahead to the January transfer window. After having some time to assess his squad, the new head coach may have a chance to bring in a couple of his players when the window opens at the start of next year.

**READ MORE: [Man United's strongest line-up after Evan Ferguson signing as Ruben Amorim handed dream move](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-uniteds-strongest-line-up-30458500)**

**READ MORE: [Manchester United dealt Euro blow as they face UEFA Youth League challenge](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-dealt-euro-blow-30458176)**

So, it’s no surprise that United continue to be linked with players. With that in mind, MEN Sport have taken a look at a couple of the stories doing the rounds, and given our own thoughts on the situation.

#### United ‘eye’ £83m man

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are reportedly interested in a move for Napoli winger Khvicha Kvaratskhelia ahead of the January transfer window. Sportmediaset, via [Get Italian Football News](https://www.getfootballnewsitaly.com/2024/manchester-united-serious-in-move-for-napolis-khvicha-kvaratskhelia/) report that United are 'serious' about the player, but would need to offer a fee of around €100 million (£83.48m) to temp Napoli into selling.

Napoli are said to be keen on getting the player tied down to a new contract, with his current one expiring in 2027. However, no agreement has yet been reached, and United are said to be willing to offer a bigger deal to the player.

**MENSport says**: _Ruben Amorim is likely to be keen to add his own players to his squad when the January transfer window opens. However, how big of a budget he will have is still to be seen._

_While Kvaratskhelia is highly-rated, the 23-year-old has scored five times and provided two assists in 13 Serie A appearances this season, it seems unlikely that United will pay the asking price in the January window. It may be a move to keep a closer eye on in the summer window._

#### Striker transfer truth

An update has been given on United’s reported interest in Paris Saint-Germain striker Randal Kolo Muani. Reports earlier this month claimed that United had held talks over a potential loan deal for the forward in the January transfer window.

However, Sky Sports Germany’s Florian Plettenberg claims that there has been no discussions over the player. Instead, the journalist names Eintracht Frankfurt’s Omar Marmoush as on a list of potential targets ahead of the January window.

**MENSport says**: _United’s search for a striker in January could depend on the future of Joshua Zirkzee. There has been reports over clubs being interested in a loan deal, but I can’t see that happening just six months into his Old Trafford Career._

_Getting a loan deal for Kolo Muani, only to send Zirkzee on loan doesn’t really make too much sense. But a possible permanent deal for Marmoush, who has been linked with several Premier League clubs, could be an interesting one to keep an eye on._

data: {"title":"Man United may have to play £86m waiting game as Amorim eyes striker transfer","description":"The latest Manchester United news and opinion as we take a look at some of the stories doing the rounds at Old Trafford over the last 24 hours.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-play-86m-waiting-30459360","content":"Manchester United may have to play £86m waiting game as Ruben Amorim eyes striker transfer - Amie Wilson - Manchester Evening News

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Manchester United may have to play £86m waiting game as Ruben Amorim eyes striker transfer
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United news and opinion as we take a look at some of the stories doing the rounds at Old Trafford over the last 24 hours.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-play-86m-waiting-30459360#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Amie Wilson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/amie-wilson/)

*   04:30, 27 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia celebrates after scoring his team's second goal during the Italian Serie A match AC Milan vs Napoli at San Siro Stadium in Milan.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30459384.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_AC-Milan-v-Napoli-Serie-A.jpg)

Khvicha Kvaratskhelia has been named as a potential January target for Manchester United and Ruben Amorim. (Image: Piero Cruciatti/Anadolu via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United head coach [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) will have his first taste of European football at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) this week, after what may be seen as a disappointing start in the Premier League.

The Red Devils [drew 1-1 with newly-promoted Ipswich Town](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-andre-30440825) in the new boss’ first game in charge on Sunday afternoon. They will look to go one better when Bodo/Glimt visit Old Trafford in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) on Thursday night (8pm kick-off).

As well as preparing for upcoming games, Amorim is also likely to be looking ahead to the January transfer window. After having some time to assess his squad, the new head coach may have a chance to bring in a couple of his players when the window opens at the start of next year.

**READ MORE: [Man United's strongest line-up after Evan Ferguson signing as Ruben Amorim handed dream move](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-uniteds-strongest-line-up-30458500)**

**READ MORE: [Manchester United dealt Euro blow as they face UEFA Youth League challenge](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-dealt-euro-blow-30458176)**

So, it’s no surprise that United continue to be linked with players. With that in mind, MEN Sport have taken a look at a couple of the stories doing the rounds, and given our own thoughts on the situation.

#### United ‘eye’ £83m man

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are reportedly interested in a move for Napoli winger Khvicha Kvaratskhelia ahead of the January transfer window. Sportmediaset, via [Get Italian Football News](https://www.getfootballnewsitaly.com/2024/manchester-united-serious-in-move-for-napolis-khvicha-kvaratskhelia/) report that United are 'serious' about the player, but would need to offer a fee of around €100 million (£83.48m) to temp Napoli into selling.

Napoli are said to be keen on getting the player tied down to a new contract, with his current one expiring in 2027. However, no agreement has yet been reached, and United are said to be willing to offer a bigger deal to the player.

**MENSport says**: _Ruben Amorim is likely to be keen to add his own players to his squad when the January transfer window opens. However, how big of a budget he will have is still to be seen._

_While Kvaratskhelia is highly-rated, the 23-year-old has scored five times and provided two assists in 13 Serie A appearances this season, it seems unlikely that United will pay the asking price in the January window. It may be a move to keep a closer eye on in the summer window._

#### Striker transfer truth

An update has been given on United’s reported interest in Paris Saint-Germain striker Randal Kolo Muani. Reports earlier this month claimed that United had held talks over a potential loan deal for the forward in the January transfer window.

However, Sky Sports Germany’s Florian Plettenberg claims that there has been no discussions over the player. Instead, the journalist names Eintracht Frankfurt’s Omar Marmoush as on a list of potential targets ahead of the January window.

**MENSport says**: _United’s search for a striker in January could depend on the future of Joshua Zirkzee. There has been reports over clubs being interested in a loan deal, but I can’t see that happening just six months into his Old Trafford Career._

_Getting a loan deal for Kolo Muani, only to send Zirkzee on loan doesn’t really make too much sense. But a possible permanent deal for Marmoush, who has been linked with several Premier League clubs, could be an interesting one to keep an eye on._

Ian Wright delivers 'perfect' Man United prediction with Ruben Amorim transfer claim
====================================================================================

Ian Wright has explained why [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) could still qualify for Europe in Ruben Amorim's first season as the club's head coach.

Amorim was appointed as United boss earlier this month following the departure of [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The 39-year-old took charge of his first match at the weekend which saw the Reds held to a 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) was appointed as United boss with the club well adrift of the top four spots, and currently find themselves in 12th place after the stalemate at Portman Road. Six points separate United from fourth, while the Reds are only three behind Tottenham Hotspur in sixth place.

It's sixth spot that Wright believes is the most likely position for United to finish this season, which would see the club qualify for Europe in the process. The former [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) striker believes that Amorim will enjoy success at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) after several new signings are added to the squad.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

"Because [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were 14th when it was all happening and he's coming in, he gives me the impression of someone that has been given time - 'Just do your stuff and play your football'," said Wright on The Kelly & Wrighty Show for [Optus Sport](https://sport.optus.com.au/epl/videos/os83772/os83772-the-kelly-and-wrighty-show).

"That's his formation, he said that when he took the job - 'That's how I know how to play and that's how we're going to play'.

"I believe once he gets his players in and they start getting it, it is a free hit against these teams for the rest of this season because Manchester United were in 14th!

"Whatever he gets from the end of this season is only going to stand him in good stead for the summer because if it does finish well for him, they're going to probably give him whatever he wants.

"For this season, if Manchester United can blast themselves up into sixth and all that, it's perfect for what they're doing with a new manager. Sixth, easy!"

Ian Wright delivers 'perfect' Man United prediction with Ruben Amorim transfer claim
====================================================================================

Latest Manchester United news and gossip as Ian Wright makes a Premier League prediction for United in Ruben Amorim's first season

![Image 1: Ian Wright](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30346294.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Ian-Wright.jpg)

Ian Wright has made a claim about Manchester United (Image: Getty)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ian Wright has explained why [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) could still qualify for Europe in Ruben Amorim's first season as the club's head coach.

Amorim was appointed as United boss earlier this month following the departure of [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The 39-year-old took charge of his first match at the weekend which saw the Reds held to a 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) was appointed as United boss with the club well adrift of the top four spots, and currently find themselves in 12th place after the stalemate at Portman Road. Six points separate United from fourth, while the Reds are only three behind Tottenham Hotspur in sixth place.

It's sixth spot that Wright believes is the most likely position for United to finish this season, which would see the club qualify for Europe in the process. The former [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) striker believes that Amorim will enjoy success at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) after several new signings are added to the squad.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

"Because [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were 14th when it was all happening and he's coming in, he gives me the impression of someone that has been given time - 'Just do your stuff and play your football'," said Wright on The Kelly & Wrighty Show for [Optus Sport](https://sport.optus.com.au/epl/videos/os83772/os83772-the-kelly-and-wrighty-show).

"That's his formation, he said that when he took the job - 'That's how I know how to play and that's how we're going to play'.

"I believe once he gets his players in and they start getting it, it is a free hit against these teams for the rest of this season because Manchester United were in 14th!

"Whatever he gets from the end of this season is only going to stand him in good stead for the summer because if it does finish well for him, they're going to probably give him whatever he wants.

"For this season, if Manchester United can blast themselves up into sixth and all that, it's perfect for what they're doing with a new manager. Sixth, easy!"

Ian Wright delivers 'perfect' Man United prediction with Ruben Amorim transfer claim
====================================================================================

Latest Manchester United news and gossip as Ian Wright makes a Premier League prediction for United in Ruben Amorim's first season
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ian-wright-delivers-easy-man-30457412#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Mark Wakefield](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/mark-wakefield/)

*   04:30, 27 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ian Wright](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30346294.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Ian-Wright.jpg)

Ian Wright has made a claim about Manchester United (Image: Getty)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Ian Wright has explained why [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) could still qualify for Europe in Ruben Amorim's first season as the club's head coach.

Amorim was appointed as United boss earlier this month following the departure of [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The 39-year-old took charge of his first match at the weekend which saw the Reds held to a 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) was appointed as United boss with the club well adrift of the top four spots, and currently find themselves in 12th place after the stalemate at Portman Road. Six points separate United from fourth, while the Reds are only three behind Tottenham Hotspur in sixth place.

It's sixth spot that Wright believes is the most likely position for United to finish this season, which would see the club qualify for Europe in the process. The former [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) striker believes that Amorim will enjoy success at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) after several new signings are added to the squad.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United confirm first quarter financial results as Omar Berrada sends message**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-confirm-net-profit-30454057)

**READ MORE: [Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

"Because [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were 14th when it was all happening and he's coming in, he gives me the impression of someone that has been given time - 'Just do your stuff and play your football'," said Wright on The Kelly & Wrighty Show for [Optus Sport](https://sport.optus.com.au/epl/videos/os83772/os83772-the-kelly-and-wrighty-show).

"That's his formation, he said that when he took the job - 'That's how I know how to play and that's how we're going to play'.

"I believe once he gets his players in and they start getting it, it is a free hit against these teams for the rest of this season because Manchester United were in 14th!

"Whatever he gets from the end of this season is only going to stand him in good stead for the summer because if it does finish well for him, they're going to probably give him whatever he wants.

"For this season, if Manchester United can blast themselves up into sixth and all that, it's perfect for what they're doing with a new manager. Sixth, easy!"

Ian Wright has explained why [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) could still qualify for Europe in Ruben Amorim's first season as the club's head coach.

Amorim was appointed as United boss earlier this month following the departure of [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag). The 39-year-old took charge of his first match at the weekend which saw the Reds held to a 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) was appointed as United boss with the club well adrift of the top four spots, and currently find themselves in 12th place after the stalemate at Portman Road. Six points separate United from fourth, while the Reds are only three behind Tottenham Hotspur in sixth place.

It's sixth spot that Wright believes is the most likely position for United to finish this season, which would see the club qualify for Europe in the process. The former [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) striker believes that Amorim will enjoy success at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) after several new signings are added to the squad.

Manchester United have been told to write this season off after a historically poor start to the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) under Erik ten Hag.

[The Dutchman](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) was fired by Ineos on October 28 following a 2-1 defeat at West Ham United. After he left [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on the Monday, [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) wasted little time finding his successor with Ruben Amorim appointed the following Friday.

Due to an agreement with Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) did not begin work at Old Trafford until Monday, November 11 - the start of the final international break of the year. As such, his first match in charge of the club came on Sunday when United drew 1-1 at Ipswich Town despite taking the lead inside 90 seconds.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on three United weaknesses during warm-ups](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE: [United have new contender for key Amorim role](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877)**

Of course, it will take longer than one match to implement a new style on this United team but former Arsenal winger Theo Walcott believes the Reds need to let this season go particularly with such a relentless run of games between now and the new year. He told [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/): "That \[implementing a new season\] is the difficulty he is going to have at this part of the season.

"The November/December period before [Christmas](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/christmas) is for me always an interesting time where it is all about recovery for the players. I think at times now, the players are just going to have to get on with it and need to learn really quickly.

"They will do a lot of walkthrough, I would have thought, but they need to get in the habits, plant the seed which will be repetition, repetition just to adapt to the system. They will have to learn very quickly but I think as well, they need to just write off this season.

"It has been a long time \[of pain\] for [Man United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and they are going to have to accept that as they have got the man they want now. But, how long will they stay in this system particularly when they want to get results?"

Erik ten Hag's Manchester United legacy to Ruben Amorim speaks volumes
======================================================================

Manchester United's new era under Ruben Amorim began with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town where the new 3-4-3 system was debuted
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   09:45, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30450440.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664130.jpg)

Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United have been told to write this season off after a historically poor start to the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) under Erik ten Hag.

[The Dutchman](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) was fired by Ineos on October 28 following a 2-1 defeat at West Ham United. After he left [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on the Monday, [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) wasted little time finding his successor with Ruben Amorim appointed the following Friday.

Due to an agreement with Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) did not begin work at Old Trafford until Monday, November 11 - the start of the final international break of the year. As such, his first match in charge of the club came on Sunday when United drew 1-1 at Ipswich Town despite taking the lead inside 90 seconds.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on three United weaknesses during warm-ups](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE: [United have new contender for key Amorim role](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877)**

Of course, it will take longer than one match to implement a new style on this United team but former Arsenal winger Theo Walcott believes the Reds need to let this season go particularly with such a relentless run of games between now and the new year. He told [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/): "That \[implementing a new season\] is the difficulty he is going to have at this part of the season.

"The November/December period before [Christmas](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/christmas) is for me always an interesting time where it is all about recovery for the players. I think at times now, the players are just going to have to get on with it and need to learn really quickly.

"They will do a lot of walkthrough, I would have thought, but they need to get in the habits, plant the seed which will be repetition, repetition just to adapt to the system. They will have to learn very quickly but I think as well, they need to just write off this season.

"It has been a long time \[of pain\] for [Man United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and they are going to have to accept that as they have got the man they want now. But, how long will they stay in this system particularly when they want to get results?"

Erik ten Hag's Manchester United legacy to Ruben Amorim speaks volumes
======================================================================

Manchester United's new era under Ruben Amorim began with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town where the new 3-4-3 system was debuted
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-manchester-united-30450414#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   09:45, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30450440.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664130.jpg)

Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United have been told to write this season off after a historically poor start to the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) under Erik ten Hag.

[The Dutchman](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) was fired by Ineos on October 28 following a 2-1 defeat at West Ham United. After he left [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on the Monday, [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) wasted little time finding his successor with Ruben Amorim appointed the following Friday.

Due to an agreement with Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) did not begin work at Old Trafford until Monday, November 11 - the start of the final international break of the year. As such, his first match in charge of the club came on Sunday when United drew 1-1 at Ipswich Town despite taking the lead inside 90 seconds.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on three United weaknesses during warm-ups](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE: [United have new contender for key Amorim role](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877)**

Of course, it will take longer than one match to implement a new style on this United team but former Arsenal winger Theo Walcott believes the Reds need to let this season go particularly with such a relentless run of games between now and the new year. He told [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/): "That \[implementing a new season\] is the difficulty he is going to have at this part of the season.

"The November/December period before [Christmas](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/christmas) is for me always an interesting time where it is all about recovery for the players. I think at times now, the players are just going to have to get on with it and need to learn really quickly.

"They will do a lot of walkthrough, I would have thought, but they need to get in the habits, plant the seed which will be repetition, repetition just to adapt to the system. They will have to learn very quickly but I think as well, they need to just write off this season.

"It has been a long time \[of pain\] for [Man United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and they are going to have to accept that as they have got the man they want now. But, how long will they stay in this system particularly when they want to get results?"

data: {"title":"Erik ten Hag's Manchester United legacy to Ruben Amorim speaks volumes","description":"Manchester United's new era under Ruben Amorim began with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town where the new 3-4-3 system was debuted","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-manchester-united-30450414","content":"Erik ten Hag's Manchester United legacy to Ruben Amorim speaks volumes - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                     

  

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Erik ten Hag's Manchester United legacy to Ruben Amorim speaks volumes
======================================================================

Manchester United's new era under Ruben Amorim began with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town where the new 3-4-3 system was debuted
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/erik-ten-hags-manchester-united-30450414#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   09:45, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30450440.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664130.jpg)

Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim (Image: Richard Pelham/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United have been told to write this season off after a historically poor start to the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) under Erik ten Hag.

[The Dutchman](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) was fired by Ineos on October 28 following a 2-1 defeat at West Ham United. After he left [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on the Monday, [the Reds](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) wasted little time finding his successor with Ruben Amorim appointed the following Friday.

Due to an agreement with Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) did not begin work at Old Trafford until Monday, November 11 - the start of the final international break of the year. As such, his first match in charge of the club came on Sunday when United drew 1-1 at Ipswich Town despite taking the lead inside 90 seconds.

**READ MORE: [Amorim is working on three United weaknesses during warm-ups](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**READ MORE: [United have new contender for key Amorim role](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877)**

Of course, it will take longer than one match to implement a new style on this United team but former Arsenal winger Theo Walcott believes the Reds need to let this season go particularly with such a relentless run of games between now and the new year. He told [Sky Sports' Monday Night Football](https://www.skysports.com/): "That \[implementing a new season\] is the difficulty he is going to have at this part of the season.

"The November/December period before [Christmas](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/christmas) is for me always an interesting time where it is all about recovery for the players. I think at times now, the players are just going to have to get on with it and need to learn really quickly.

"They will do a lot of walkthrough, I would have thought, but they need to get in the habits, plant the seed which will be repetition, repetition just to adapt to the system. They will have to learn very quickly but I think as well, they need to just write off this season.

"It has been a long time \[of pain\] for [Man United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and they are going to have to accept that as they have got the man they want now. But, how long will they stay in this system particularly when they want to get results?"

Ruben Amorim could be about to unleash a new Manchester United defence
======================================================================

Man United head coach Ruben Amorim could potentially mix up his side's defensive line this week.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*

*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-could-unleash-new-30456054#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[George Smith](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/george-smith/)Senior Football Writer

*   04:00, 27 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim shakes hands with Matthijs de Ligt after the 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30456909.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2186664000.jpg)

Ruben Amorim could consider a fresh approach this week. (Image: Stephen Pond/Getty Images.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

After completing the signing of Noussair Mazraoui from Bayern Munich in August, Manchester United sporting director Dan Ashworth was quick to commend the Moroccan's versatility.

"Noussair is a dynamic, attacking full-back who can play on both the right and left side of defence," [Ashworth](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/dan-ashworth) said. "His experience and versatility will make him an excellent addition to our squad."

A little over three months after putting pen to paper on a four-year contract at Old Trafford, few could have possibly envisioned just how versatile he actually is. After playing as a right-back, a left-back and as an attacking-midfielder under former [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) manager Erik ten Hag, his successor, Ruben Amorim, deployed him as a right-sided centre-back for his first game in charge against Ipswich Town on Sunday afternoon.

**READ MORE:** **[United CEO Omar Berrada offers Old Trafford regeneration update](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-ceo-omar-berrada-30454814)**

**READ MORE:** **[Ruben Amorim might have already found his most important player for his United plan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-might-already-found-30452668)**

Setting up with the 3-4-3 formation that had been religiously analysed ever since succeeding Ten Hag on November 1, the former Sporting Lisbon boss tasked [Mazraoui](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/noussair-mazraoui) with operating on the right side of the back-three. He was joined in the defence by [Matthijs de Ligt](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/matthijs-de-ligt) and Jonny Evans.

Of that rearguard, only De Ligt will be considered as a staple in United's first-choice backline once everyone is fit and available. The general expectation is that once Amorim has overseen a reduction in the size of the current injury list, De Ligt will be joined in defence by fellow summer signing [Leny Yoro](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/leny-yoro) and Lisandro Martinez.

Yoro was not included in the matchday squad at Portman Road, with United continuing to monitor his recovery from a fractured metatarsal carefully, and Martinez missed out due to a back injury. With Harry Maguire and Victor Lindelof also missing, Amorim had no choice but to make do with what he had available.

However, as reported by the _[Manchester Evening News](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-takes-decision-leny-30417554)_ last week, Yoro is understood to be on the cusp of making his competitive debut for United. It is possible he could be awarded it this week, either against Bodo/Glimt on Thursday night or when Everton visit Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.

Yoro was United's statement signing of the summer, being signed from Lille in a deal initially worth £52.2million. He was on Real Madrid's radar but yet United convinced him to move to Old Trafford.

  

![Image 3: Leny Yoro smiles for the camera as he is pictured in training at Carrington.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/article30456869.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2185450759.jpg)

Leny Yoro could soon make his competitive debut for Manchester United. (Image: Ash Donelon/Manchester United via Getty Images.)

The feeling is he will soon occupy the right-sided centre-back berth Mazraoui held against Ipswich. Once Martinez is back, he should join Yoro and De Ligt in making up United's first-choice back-three.

However, Martinez's return is understood not to be imminent, opening up a window of opportunity for someone else to stake a claim for the left-sided centre-back berth. That someone could be [Luke Shaw](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/luke-shaw).

A whopping 280 days after he made his last United appearance, the England international made his long-awaited comeback against Ipswich, appearing as a second half substitute. He slotted into the left-sided centre-back role after replacing Evans.

Shaw has experience of playing centrally for United, being tasked with playing as a left-sided centre-back several times by Ten Hag during the 2022/23 season. He admitted after a 1-0 win over Wolves on New Year's Eve in 2022 that he was "really enjoying" the responsibility.

After so long out, United's primary mission has to be managing Shaw's load carefully and keeping him out of the treatment room. They cannot afford to push him too quickly.

But if he is deemed fit enough to start for United at any point within the next week or so, he is a credible option to start in the left-sided centre-back berth. He has the ball-playing ability to play in a central area and he is defensively sound.

Of course, Martinez should be reinstated as United's chief left-sided centre-back once he recovers from his current injury, but Shaw is a solid option to compete with him and provide rotation.

The prospect of Yoro debuting in the coming days and Shaw being deemed fit enough to start will provide United with two very welcomed boosts. Yoro's addition to the squad in July was greeted with a wave of appreciation and Shaw, regardless of his injury concerns, is a fantastic player when he is fit.

The prospect of those two operating either side of De Ligt in a back-three would offer United something completely different to what was on show at Ipswich, and Amorim would be well within his rights to test the water with that approach.
